borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span style="font-size:11pt">&nbsp;The scale and siting of the proposed dwelling in a rear garden setting would result in significant disturbance to <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="neighbouring" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdv8snjh296kv">neighbouring</span> occupiers through the&nbsp;additional generation of noise, waste, smoke, fumes and comings and goings, particularly given the close proximity to surrounding dwellings.&nbsp;The development would therefore constitute <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="unneighbourly" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0ke344usir6h42">unneighbourly</span> development and is contrary to: - National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0ke33x8grdt8d5">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0ke32ja7dozdb0">DLUHC</span>, 2021); - Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp; - Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp; - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp; - Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); - The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span><br></div><div><p><o:p></o:p></p></div>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">On account of its siting&nbsp;within a rear garden setting, the proposed development is at odds with the surrounding pattern of development and disrupts&nbsp;the natural break between existing surrounding dwellings provided by the rear gardens. The proposed dwelling has no presence from the street scene, failing&nbsp;to accord&nbsp;with the character and appearance&nbsp;of the area. The proposal therefore represents an&nbsp;inappropriate and uncharacteristic residential form in a rear garden setting&nbsp;which is detrimental to the character and appearance of the property, terrace row and the surrounding area. The proposal is contrary to: -National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="MHCLG" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdr4bpyd8g0s5">MHCLG</span>, February 2019); -Policies D1, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);- Policies SP2, DMD 1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation Version, October 2020); - The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">The applicant has failed to&nbsp;accurately portray the development and use of the outbuilding. Specifically the</span>&nbsp;applicant has presented conflicting information regarding the existing use of the site, referring to it both as a&nbsp;'granny <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="annexe" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0o1e8flzrhc72t">annexe</span>' related to the main <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0o7tas1qfsnikn">dwellinghouse</span>, but also&nbsp;as a self-contained studio flat.&nbsp;Additionally, the&nbsp;<span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">plans provided fail to accurately portray&nbsp;the bathroom&nbsp;at the outbuilding.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">The proposal could prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the application; the proposed development cannot be accurately assessed and it cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">- National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdexlb6j1nebl">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdewxc3sybubg">DLUHC</span>, 2021);&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">- Policies&nbsp;D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">- Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">- Policies SP2, SP3, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021);&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">By reason of failing to meet the minimum gross internal area requirement, provide any private external amenity, facilitate adequate privacy, outlook, sunlight or&nbsp;daylight for future occupiers or present an acceptable independent&nbsp;access arrangement, the proposed self-contained dwelling unit provides an unacceptable standard of accommodation. The proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to:- National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="MHCLG" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdiela4e29fc3">MHCLG</span>, July 2021); - Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021); -Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework&nbsp; Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;- Policies BP5, BP6, BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2, SP3, DMD6 and DMD1 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (October 2020); -<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DCLG" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdid931yk72cx">DCLG</span> Technical Housing Standards (nationally described space standard) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DCLG" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdidu8n65c413">DCLG</span>, March 2015) (as amended)</span><br></p>
site_name: 108 Hatfield Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 6JS
description: Retrospective application for the use of outbuilding as self-contained residential accommodation

constraints_details.result: 108 Hatfield Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 6JS
